intro: Peixotoa spinensis, commonly known as the spinous peixotoa, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spiny stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens. Peixotoa spinensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within the understory of dense tropical forests.
